meanings.definition: A booth where tolls are collected
meanings.sent1: The tollbooths on the highway were busy with cars stopping to pay.
meanings.sent2: Drivers had to pass through the tollbooths to continue on the road.
meanings.sent3: The tollbooths seemed to have a never-ending line of vehicles waiting to pay.
meanings.sent4: The tollbooths stood like guardians, ensuring every driver paid their dues.
meanings.sent5: The tollbooths gleamed in the sunlight, beckoning drivers to stop and pay up.

meanings.definition: A structure on a highway where drivers must pay a fee
meanings.sent1: The tollbooths were the last obstacle before reaching the city.
meanings.sent2: Passing through the tollbooths meant leaving the countryside behind.
meanings.sent3: The tollbooths looked like little houses where cars had to drop off coins.
meanings.sent4: The tollbooths marked the transition from the open road to the urban landscape.
meanings.sent5: The tollbooths loomed ahead, signaling the end of the journey and the start of city life.
